metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4589 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ExportAlphaQuantumType function in export.c in GraphicsMagick before1.3.18 might allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash)via vectors related to exporting the alpha of an 8-bit RGBA image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4589` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3
libgraphicsmagick++11 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3').
